medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 reported right arm weakness since age 5, with progressively developing weakness in other limbs starting at age 35. A chest X-ray at age 40 revealed an elevated right hemidiaphragm. Patient 2 experienced weakness in the left arm, hand, and leg since age 8, with generalized weakness beginning in her late 30s and chest X-ray at age 41 revealing an elevated left hemidiaphragm. Patient 3's right arm weakness increased at age 22, although her X-ray was unremarkable. Patient 4 experienced left arm weakness since age 6, with progressive weakness in other limbs starting at age 40 and a chest X-ray at age 42 indicating an elevated left hemidiaphragm.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Mutations in the myotubularin (MTM1) gene related to myopathy.
medical_history.family_history: Two of Patient 1's nine sisters have a similar condition, and two of four male siblings died in infancy from uncertain causes. Patient 4 had a grandson who died at age 3 from myotubular myopathy.
